September 26, 2025
Training

New Mandatory Training Module: Digital Safeguarding

A comprehensive new training module on digital safeguarding and online safety is now available for all external partners.

We're introducing a new mandatory training module focusing on digital safeguarding practices, particularly important as more programs incorporate online elements.

What's Covered:

  • Online safety protocols for virtual sessions
  • Digital privacy protection for participants
  • Recognizing and responding to online risks
  • Secure communication practices

All external partners must complete this module by October 31, 2025. The training is available through your dashboard and takes approximately 2 hours to complete.

Mandatory Digital Safety Deadline: Oct 31
September 23, 2025
Policy

Updated Partnership Agreement Terms

Important updates to partnership agreements include new insurance requirements and revised reporting procedures.

We've updated our partnership agreements to better reflect current best practices and regulatory requirements.

Key Changes:

  • Increased minimum insurance coverage to $15 million
  • Monthly reporting requirements now include participant satisfaction surveys
  • New background check renewal timeline (every 2 years)
  • Enhanced incident reporting procedures

Existing partners have until January 1, 2026, to comply with new requirements. Our partnership team will contact you individually to discuss implementation.

Important Legal Action Required

Program Highlights:

System

Dashboard Enhancement: New Reporting Features

Improved reporting capabilities now available including automated monthly summaries and enhanced participant tracking.

We've enhanced the partner dashboard with new reporting features to streamline your administrative tasks and improve program tracking.

New Features:

  • Automated monthly report generation
  • Real-time attendance tracking
  • Participant progress visualization
  • Custom report templates
  • One-click report submission

These features are now live in your dashboard. A brief tutorial video is available to help you get started with the new tools.

Dashboard Reports Live Now
September 15, 2025
Urgent

Emergency Contact Information Updated

Important: New emergency contact numbers effective immediately for all safeguarding and crisis situations.

Please update your emergency contact information immediately. The following numbers have changed:

New Emergency Contacts:

  • Primary Emergency Line: 1800-MALAIKA-2 (replaces 1800-MALAIKA)
  • After Hours Supervisor: 0400-555-0123
  • Safeguarding Officer: 0400-555-0456

Old numbers will be redirected for the next 30 days, but please update your records, emergency procedures, and any posted contact information immediately.

Emergency Action Required Update Records
September 10, 2025
Training

Mental Health First Aid Training Available

Optional professional development opportunity: Accredited Mental Health First Aid training for external partners.

We're offering subsidized Mental Health First Aid training for external partners interested in expanding their support capabilities.

Training Details:

  • 12-hour accredited course over 2 days
  • Multiple session times available
  • 70% subsidized cost (partners pay $150, usual cost $500)
  • Nationally recognized certification
  • Continuing education credits available

Priority registration for external partners closes October 1st. This training is particularly valuable for partners working with teen and adult participants.

Optional Subsidized Registration Closes Oct 1
September 5, 2025
Announcement

Partnership Impact Report 2025 Released

View the comprehensive impact report showcasing the collective achievements of our external partnership program.

Our annual Partnership Impact Report highlights the incredible work and outcomes achieved through our external partnership program.

Report Highlights:

  • 247 participants supported across all external programs
  • 15 external partner organizations contributing
  • 96% participant satisfaction rating
  • 89% achievement of individual program goals
  • Case studies from successful partnerships

Thank you to all our external partners for making these outcomes possible. Your dedication and professionalism continue to make a real difference in our community.

Impact Recognition Annual Report
